title: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis
text: Results can viewed directly flextable object.
code: # Show data frame as a flextable object.  dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs) |> ft() #> Adding missing grouping variables: `vs`

title: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis
text: Variables can quickly visualised exploratory graphical analysis.
code: # Scatter plot showing correlation.  dat |> ggxy(hp,disp) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' # Histograms of all continuous variables.  dat |> gghist() #> NB: Non-numeric variables are dropped. #> Dropped: cyl vs am gear carb # Box plots stratified by categorical variables.  dat |> ggbox(mpg) #> NB: Numeric variables are dropped. #> Dropped: disp hp drat wt qsec # Violin plots stratified by categorical variables.  dat |> ggvio(mpg) #> NB: Numeric variables are dropped. #> Dropped: disp hp drat wt qsec #> Warning: Groups with fewer than two datapoints have been dropped. #> ℹ Set `drop = FALSE` to consider such groups for position adjustment purposes. #> Groups with fewer than two datapoints have been dropped. #> ℹ Set `drop = FALSE` to consider such groups for position adjustment purposes. # Time-profile plot by subject. Theoph |> ggtpp(Time,conc,id=Subject,xlab="Time [h]",ylab="Concentration [mg/L]")

title: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis
text: label indicating current source file time stamp can easily generated annotation.
code: # To generate a source file label for annotation. lab = label_src() # A source file label can be directly added to the flextable output.  dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs) |> ft(src=1) # A source file label can be directly added to a ggplot object.  p = dat |> ggxy(hp,disp) p |> ggsrc()

what: edar: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis — edar-package
title: edar: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis — edar-package
text: collection convenient functions facilitate common tasks exploratory data analysis. common tasks include generating summary tables variables, displaying tables 'flextable' 'kable' visualising variables using 'ggplot2'. Labels stating source file run time can easily generated annotation tables plots.

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy
text: Create basic XY scatter plot quick data exploration. Default show Pearson correlation coefficient p-value using ggpubr::stat_cor. complex plots, recommended use ggplot2::ggplot2 directly.

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy
text: d <dfr> data frame. x, y <var> Variables x- y-axis unquoted names. ... Arguments pass ggplot2::aes additional mapping. lm <lgl> TRUE add regression line linear model. se <lgl> TRUE show standard error regression line. cor <lgl> TRUE show Pearson correlation coefficient p-value. pv <dbl> Precision p-value, e.g., 0.001 show 3 decimal places. nsub <lgl> Show number observations. legend <lgl> TRUE show legend. asp <num> aspect.ratio ggplot2::theme.
